Client.Name: Frederico Liporace、National Institute of Standards and Technology、Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute

Project.Brief history of your project and organi: As technical developers, we joined web3 early and developed some projects. At the same time, we learned about Filecoin three years ago and helped SP download, store, back up, and repair data in the past year.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
https://registry.opendata.aws/amazonia：
Imagery acquired by Amazonia-1 satellite. The image files are recorded and processed by Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE) and are converted to Cloud Optimized Geotiff format in order to optimize its use for cloud based applications. WFI Level 4 (Orthorectified) scenes are being ingested daily starting from 08-29-2022, the complete Level 4 archive will be ingested by the end of October 2022.

https://registry.opendata.aws/pacific-sound：
This project offers passive acoustic data (sound recordings) from a deep-ocean environment off central California. Recording began in July 2015, has been nearly continuous, and is ongoing. These resources are intended for applications in ocean soundscape research, education, and the arts.

https://registry.opendata.aws/giab：
Several reference genomes to enable translation of whole human genome sequencing to clinical practice.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: We developed our own platform using tools developed by Venus. In terms of data retrieval, the feature is to use scripts to traverse and execute. In terms of data download, we download the data according to the AWS command line. After downloading, we use the open source go-graphsplit of the fileddrive-team to cut it into small files of a specified size. The csv file will store the piece_cid and size information corresponding to the source file.
